search.desc: Search for keywords within the Lucee Administrator
search.label: Search the Lucee Administrator

application.allowurlrequesttimeoutdesc: When the URL parameter [RequestTimeout] is passed in the URL obey it
application.AllowRequestTimeoutDesc: This setting is only possible via System Property / Enviroment Variable.
application.concurrentrequestthreshold: Request Timeout Threshold for Concurrent Requests
application.concurrentrequestthresholdDesc: This setting enables you to specify a threshold for the number of concurrent requests that Lucee can handle before beginning to enforce request timeouts. By adjusting this threshold, you can fine-tune how Lucee manages request timeouts under varying loads. A higher threshold allows more concurrent requests to be processed without enforcing timeouts, potentially improving performance under heavy load at the risk of longer request times. The default threshold is set to 0, meaning request timeouts are enforced immediately for all requests. This setting is only possible via System Property / Enviroment Variable.
application.cputhreshold: CPU Usage Threshold for Request Timeouts
application.cputhresholdDesc: This configuration option allows you to set a CPU usage threshold that Lucee monitors before enforcing request timeouts. The threshold value is a float ranging from 0.0 (representing 0% CPU usage) to 1.0 (indicating 100% CPU usage). When the system's CPU usage is below this threshold, Lucee processes requests without applying the request timeout rule, enabling smoother handling under varying system loads. This mechanism is particularly useful for managing resource allocation and maintaining optimal application responsiveness, especially during periods of high demand or limited system resources. The default setting is 0.0, which means request timeouts are applied regardless of CPU usage. Adjusting this threshold provides a strategic lever to balance between system performance and request responsiveness, tailoring Lucee's behavior to your specific operational needs. This setting is only possible via System Property / Enviroment Variable.
application.memorythreshold: Memory Usage Threshold for Request Timeouts
application.memorythresholdDesc: This setting permits the establishment of a memory usage threshold, guiding Lucee on when to begin enforcing request timeouts based on the system's current memory consumption. The threshold value is a float from 0.0 (indicating 0% memory usage) to 1.0 (representing 100% memory usage). By monitoring memory usage against this threshold, Lucee intelligently decides whether to enforce or relax request timeouts, offering a dynamic approach to resource management. This is particularly advantageous for preventing system overloads and ensuring stable performance by not strictly applying timeouts when memory usage is below the defined threshold. The default threshold is set to 0.0, meaning Lucee will apply request timeouts without considering memory usage. Adjusting this threshold allows for more nuanced control over how your applications respond under various memory load conditions, optimizing both performance and reliability. This setting is only possible via System Property / Enviroment Variable.
application.ConcurrentRequestDesc: This setting defines how the system handles concurrent requests.
application.ConcurrentRequestMaxDesc: The maximum concurrent requests that the engine allows to run at the same time, before the engine begins to queue the requests.
application.ConcurrentRequestMaxError: Maximal concurrent request must be an integer
application.ConcurrentRequestTimeoutDesc: The time a request is held in the queue. If the time is reached the request is rejected with an exception. If you have set 0 seconds the request timeout is used instead.
application.listenerdescription: Sets how requests are handled and which templates are invoked by default.
application.listenermodedescription: Defines where Lucee looks for the files "Application.cfc/Application.cfm". In case of type "none" this setting is meaningless.
application.listenermodedescription_curr2root: Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" from the current up to the webroot directory.
application.listenermodedescription_current: Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" only in the current template directory .
application.listenermodedescription_currorroot: Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" in the current directory and in the webroot directory.
application.listenermodedescription_root: Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" only in the webroot .
application.listenertypedescription: Please select the type of the listener
application.listenertypedescription_classic: Classic handling. Lucee looks for the file "Application.cfm" and a corresponding file "OnRequestEnd.cfm"
application.listenertypedescription_mixed: Mixed handling. Lucee looks for a file "Application.cfm/OnRequestEnd.cfm" as well as for the file "Application.cfc"
application.listenertypedescription_modern: Modern handling. Lucee only looks for the file "Application.cfc"
application.listenertypedescription_none: When a request is called no other initialization template will be invoked by Lucee
application.missingscriptprotect: Please select a value for script-protect
application.RequestTimeoutDesc: Defines how Lucee handles long running requests.
application.requesttimeoutdescription: Sets the amount of time the engine will wait for a request to finish before a request timeout will be raised. This means that the execution of the request will be stopped. This setting can be overridden using the â€œcfsetting" tag or script equivalent.
application.scriptprotectall: Script-protect checks in all scopes for external data (cgi,cookie,form,url)
application.scriptprotectcustom: You can define the scopes to be checked individually
application.scriptprotectdescription: The configuration of Script protect secures your system from "cross-site scripting"
application.web: Here you can define several default settings for the application context. These settings can be overridden with the tag cfapplication or the Application.cfc.

components.datamemberaccesstypedescription: Define the accessor for the data-members of a component. This defines how variables of the "this" scope of a component can be accessed from outside of the component.

components.nameDesc: The name is used as identifier when you automatically import a Lucee Archive build based on this Mapping.
components.nameMissing: Missing the name for the new Mapping, this name is used when you deploy a Lucee Archive (.lar) based on this Mapping.

components.PrimaryDesc: Defines where Lucee does looks first for a requested component
components.server: Define the component settings that will be used as a default for all web contexts.
components.triggerdatamemberdescription: If there is no accessible data member (property, element of the this scope) inside a component, Lucee searches for available matching "getters" or "setters" for the requested property. The following example should clarify this behaviour. "somevar = myComponent.properyName". If "myComponent" has no accessible data member named "propertyName", Lucee searches for a function member (method) named "getPropertyName".
components.trustedDesc: When does Lucee checks for changes in the source file for an already loaded component
components.useshadowdescription: Defines whether a component has an independent variables scope parallel to the "this" scope (CFML standard) or not.
components.web: Defines how components will be handled by Lucee.

debug.createTitle: Create a Template for a specific IP Range
debug.debuggingDisabled: Debugging logs are currently disabled in settings
debug.debugtemplatedescription: This template is used for formatting the debugging output
debug.debugtemplatemissing: Please enter a value for the debug template
debug.detailDesc: Detailed information about a single Request
debug.enabledescription:
If set to "yes" Lucee logs the debug information you have selected below.
you can see the log result at the end of every request if a debug template is defined or under Debug/Logs in this administrator.
debug.filterPath: Only Outputs records where the path match the following pattern.
debug.ipRangeDesc:
A comma separated list of strings of ip definitions. The following patterns are allowed:
	- * including all ips
	- a single ip, like ""127.0.0.1"" or ""0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0""
	- an ip with wildcards like ""127.0.0.*"", in this case all ips between ""127.0.0.0"" and ""127.0.0.255"" are valid
	- an ip range like ""127.0.0.1-127.0.0.10"", in this case all ips between ""127.0.0.1"" and ""127.0.0.10"" are valid
	You can define IPv4 or IPv6 IPs, an IPv4 can not be converted to an IPv6 and visa versa.
debug.label: Label
debug.labelMissing: you need to define the label for the debug template

list.createDesc: Define a debug template to show the debug information at the end of a request. Defining a template is not necessary to log the debug information.
list.serverTitleDesc: Readonly debug templates are generated within the ""server administrator"" for all web instances and can not be modified by the ""web administrator"".
list.webTitleDesc: list of existing debug templates defined.

debug.logmemoryusagedescription: Sets whether the memory usage should be logged

debug.minExeTimeDesc: Minimal Execution Time that Lucee outputs the debugger information of a request.
debug.noAccess: you have no access to manipulate the debug settings
debug.noDriver: there is no debug template defined
debug.onlyWebContext: Debugging logs are only visible via the web context, or in single mode
debug.pathRestrictionDesc: Path that should not be outputted, separated path by line break.
debug.settingDesc: Configure the size of the debug logs.

settings.databaseDesc: Select this option to log the database activity for the SQL Query events and Stored Procedure events.
settings.desc: Enable certain logging options for Lucee
settings.dumpDesc: Select this option to enable output produced with help of the tag cfdump and send to debugging.
settings.exceptionDesc: Select this option to log all exceptions raised for the request.
settings.implicitAccessDesc: Select this option to log all accesses to scopes, queries and threads that happens implicit (cascaded).
settings.queryUsageDesc: Select this option to log the query usage information.
settings.templateDesc: Select this option log template activity for all cfm and cfc templates.
settings.threadAlert: Depending on your application, this may produce a large volume of debug entries.
settings.threadDesc: Select this option to also log threads.
settings.timerDesc: Select this option to show timer event information. Timers let a developer track the execution time of the code between the start and end tags of the CFTIMER tag.
settings.tracingDesc: Select this option to log trace event information. Tracing lets a developer track program flow and efficiency through the use of the CFTRACE tag.

arg.max: Only the number of arguments is restricted to {max}.
arg.min: It must have at least {min} arguments.
arg.minmax: It must have at least {min} arguments but a maximum of {max}.
arg.name: Name

type.dynamic: There is no restriction for this function regarding its arguments.
type.fixed: The arguments for this function are set. You can not use other arguments except the following ones.

attr.max: Only the number of attributes is restricted to {max}.
attr.min: This tag must have at least {min} attributes.
attr.minmax: This tag must have at least {min} attributes but the most {max}.
attr.name: Name

type.dynamic: There is no restriction for attributes for this tag.
type.fixed: The attributes for this tag are fixed. Except for the following attributes no other attributes are allowed.
type.mixed: This tag has a fixed definition of attributes (see below). In addition it allows to use any additional attribute.
type.noname: This tag only allows one attribute value (no name).

body.free: This tag may have a body.
body.prohibited: This tag can't have a body.
body.required: This tag must have a body.

err.descr: Please enter an individual error template.
err.errorstatuscodedescription: In case of an exception, should individual status codes be returned? Untick to always return 200 status code.

errortemplatedescription.404: Template that will be invoked in case of a missing error. This setting can be overridden by the tag CFError.
errortemplatedescription.500: Template that will be invoked in case of an error. This setting can be overridden by the tag CFError.

mailservers.global: Mail server connections (Connections from Server Administrator)

mailserversdescription.global:
These connections have been created in the Server Administrator and are shared with ALL web contexts. 
		You cannot modify these mail servers in the Web Administrator.
		You can define more than one mail server connection. When sending an email, Lucee tries to send the mail with the first defined mail server. If the send operation fails, Lucee will continue using the next mail server in the list.
mailserversdescription.local: You can define more than one mail server connection. When sending an email, Lucee tries to send the mail with the first defined mail server. If the send operation fails, Lucee will continue using the next mail server in the list.

mail.maxThreadsDesc: This setting can be changed on page "Services/Taks". Maximum number of threads that are executed at the same time to send the mails, fewer threads will take longer to send all the mail, more threads will add more load to the system.
mail.missingencoding: Please enter a value for the default encoding
mail.passwordmissing: Please enter a value for the corresponding password.
mail.portDesc: Port of the mail server (for example 587).
mail.porterrorfirst: Please enter a value for the port.
mail.serverDesc: Mail server host name (for example smtp.gmail.com).
mail.servermissing: Please enter a value for the mailserver.
mail.SpoolEnabledDesc: If enabled, the mails are sent in a background thread and the main request does not have to wait until the mails are sent.
mail.TimeoutDesc: Time in seconds that the Task Manager waits to send a single mail, when the time is reached the Task Manager stops the thread and the mail gets moved to unsent folder, where the Task Manager will pick it up later to try to send it again.
mail.usernamemissing: Please enter a value for the username

overview.blogDesc: The latest news from Lucee is always posted on our blog.
overview.bookDesc: A complete guide to developing an application with Lucee from start to finish.

contexts.desc: You can label your web contexts here, so they are more clearly distinguishable for use with extensions etc. The default label of a web context is the MD5 hash of its webroot.
contexts.label: Label
contexts.title: Web contexts

overview.DocsDesc: If you have any questions about Lucee please take a look at the documentation in the first instance.
overview.ErrorWhileReadingLangFile: An error occurred while reading the language file.
overview.installDocsLink: Click to install - Lucee Documentation Extension

introdesc.server: The Server Administrator allows you to install updates and patches for your Lucee installation and to restart the engine with a mouse click. You can configure new web contexts, define restrictions, and configurations per web context individual.
introdesc.web: Lucee, the CFML engine - free, open source and easy to use. This Web Administrator is provided in order to customize your web context.

overview.issuetrackerDesc: If you think you've found a bug, please take the time to report it via our bug tracking system.
overview.Label: Label
overview.langAlreadyExists: The language file you uploaded contains a language that already exists in this context.
overview.LangFileSeemsIncomplete: The language file you uploaded seems to be incomplete. Please note that only files that are at least 80% complete can be used.
overview.LangFileUploaded: The language file for [lang] has been uploaded. It is [%] complete.
overview.licencecommunitydesc: Lucee Community is intended to be used by low budget business applicants. Except for some few limitations the Community Version offers the entire language range of Lucee.
overview.licencedesc: Lucee is available in four different editions, adapted to the different areas of application and budgets.
overview.licencedevelopdesc: The Develop Version is a version, addressing those users who are most likely to apply it in order for assembling CFML application . The version though is prohibited to be used commercially.
overview.licenceenterprisedesc: The Enterprise Version of Lucee is the biggest and most comprehensive version intended to be used in a larger context.
overview.licenceprofessionaldesc: The Professional Version offers the full language range of Lucee, no restriction to the use of any feature has to be expected. With the Professional Version several web contexts can be used on one server, the number of web contexts however is limited by the licence price.
overview.localRefDesc: Local reference for tags, functions and components.
overview.mailinglistDesc: The mailing list is the focus of our community support program - help for users by users.
overview.modeMultiDesc: You are running Lucee in Multi Mode. In Multi Mode, you use the Server Administrator to configure overall settings for all web contexts/webs, and use individual Web Administrators to customize settings for each web context/web.
overview.modeSingleDesc: You are running Lucee in Single Mode. In Single Mode, you use a single Administrator to configure settings for all web contexts/webs. No individual Web Administrators exist.
overview.modeMultiSwitchDesc: Activating Single Mode will result in having a single Administrator to configure settings for all web contexts/webs. No individual Web Administrators will exist.
overview.modeSingleSwitchDesc: Activating Multi Mode will result in having a Server Administrator to configure overall settings for all web contexts/webs and individual Web Administrators to customize settings for each web context/web.
overview.switchMergeDesc: All settings from all web contexts/webs get stored into the server context
overview.switchLeaveDesc: Switch to Single Mode and forget all settings done in all web contexts/webs
overview.switchKeep: Keep all web context/web configuration in place so a return to Multi Mode is possible

pool.HEAP_desc: Memory used for all objects that are allocated.
pool.NON_HEAP_desc: Memory used to store all cfc/cfm templates, java classes, interned Strings and meta-data.
pool.Par Eden Space: The pool from which memory is initially allocated for most objects.
pool.Par Survivor Space: The pool containing objects that have survived the garbage collection of the Eden space.
pool.CMS Old Gen: The pool containing objects that have existed for some time in the survivor space.
pool.CMS Perm Gen: The pool containing all the reflective data of the virtual machine itself, such as class and method objects.
pool.Code Cache: The HotSpot Java VM also includes a code cache, containing memory that is used for compilation and storage of native code.

overview.professionalDesc: For many organizations and individuals, the security of a formal paid support contract is a necessity. We are pleased to offer four standard packages as well as the flexibility to create a custom package should your needs go beyond our standard offerings.

warning.Java7NotSupport: Java 7 has been End-of-Life'd since April 2015.
warning.JavaVersion: You are running Lucee with Java
warning.JavaVersionNotSupport: Lucee does not formally support this version of Java. Consider updating to the latest Java version for security and performance reasons.
warning.warningMsg: The REST Servlet is not configured in your environment!

proxy.serverdescription: URL of a proxy server eg."http://myproxyserver.org/"
proxy.web: Define a global proxy, that will be used in several tags by default (cfhttp,cfftp,cfmail ...)

regional.localedescription: Define the desired time locale for Lucee, this will change the default locale for the context of the web.

regional.server: You can define regional settings that will be used as a default for all web contexts here. These settings have no direct effect on the current instance. Lucee lets you set your own individual locale, timezone, and timeserver.
regional.timeserverdescription: Time server that returns the current time. If set, this time will be used within Lucee instead of the local server time. (Example: swisstime.ethz.ch, time.nist.gov)
regional.timeservermissing: Please define a value for the field timezone
regional.timezonedescription: Define the desired time zone for Lucee. This will also change the time for the context of the web.
regional.web: Lucee lets you set your own individual locale, timezone, and timeserver.

schedule.currentdatetime: The current date/time of this Lucee context is:
schedule.description: Here you can add, modify, run, and delete scheduled tasks
schedule.detaildescription: The tasks displayed in red have expired and will no longer start.
schedule.enddatedesc: Define a date when the task should be executed the last time.
schedule.endsatdescdaily: Defines the date when the task should be executed the last time.
schedule.endsatdescmonthly: Defines a date within the task should be executed the last time.
schedule.endsatdescweekly: Defines a date within the task should be executed the last time.
schedule.endtimedesc: Define the time when Lucee stop to executed the task within every day.
schedule.executeatdesc: Defines the date and time when the task should be executed.
schedule.executiondescdaily: This task is executed once a day.
schedule.executiondescevery: This task is executed in a certain interval.
schedule.executiondescmonthly: This task is executed once a month.
schedule.executiondesconce: This task is executed only once at a specific date and time.
schedule.executiondescweekly: This task is executed once a week.
schedule.executiontimedescdaily: Defines the time when the Task is executed daily
schedule.executiontimedescmonthly: Defines the time when the Task is executed monthly
schedule.executiontimedescweekly: Defines the time when the Task is executed weekly
schedule.filedescription: File the output is stored to
schedule.intervaldesc: Interval in that the task will be executed
schedule.intervaltypedesc: Execution interval of the new task
schedule.name: Name
schedule.namedescedit: URL that will be invoked by the task
schedule.namedescription: Name of the new task (this name must be unique)
schedule.namemissing: Please enter a value for the name of the task
schedule.outputdesc: With the following settings you can define, if Lucee should store the result of the url invocation and where Lucee should store this result
schedule.passworddescription: Password to access the URL if it is protected by authentication
schedule.pausedesc: By setting this flag, the execution of the task will be paused.
schedule.portdescription: Port of the URL to call (HTTP Default: 80)
schedule.proxydesc: When there is a Proxy Server between the Lucee Server and the called URL, you can define the Proxy Servers Setting here to access the URL
schedule.proxypassword: Password to access a proxy if it is  protected by authentication
schedule.proxyserverdesc: The address of the proxy server (example: my.proxy.com)
schedule.proxyusername: Username to access a proxy if it is  protected by authentication
schedule.startdatedesc: Defines the date when the task should be executed the first time.
schedule.startsatdesc: Defines the date when the task should be executed the first time.
schedule.starttimedesc: Defines the time when Lucee starts to executed the task within every day.
schedule.storeresponse: Sets, whether the response of server will be stored in a file or not
schedule.timeoutdescription: Timeout in seconds. Defines how long a task will wait for the response of the server called by the URL
schedule.urlmissing: Please enter a value for the URL of the task
schedule.useragentdescription: Custom User Agent for the http(s) request (some firewalls block the CFSCHEDULE user agent)
schedule.usernamedescription: Username to access the URL if it is protected by authentication

scopes.applicationtimeoutdescription: Sets the amount of time Lucee will keep the application scope alive. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
scopes.cascadetoresultsetdescription: When a variable has no scope defined (Example: #myVar# instead of #variables.myVar#), Lucee will also search available resultsets (CFML Standard) or not
scopes.cascadingdescription:
Depending on this setting Lucee scans certain scopes to find a variable called from the CFML source. This will only happen when the variable is called without a scope. (Example: #myVar# instead of #variables.myVar#)
- strict: scans only the variables scope
- small: scans the scopes variables,url,form
- standard (CFML Standard): scans the scopes variables,cgi,url,form,cookie
scopes.cgiReadOnlyDesc: Defines whether the CGI Scope is read only or not.
scopes.cgiReadOnlyFalseDesc: The CGI Scope can be changed like other scopes.
scopes.cgiReadOnlyTrueDesc: The CGI Scope cannot be manipulated.
scopes.clientcookiesdescription: Enable or disable client cookies. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
scopes.clientmanagementdescription: By default client management can be enabled. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
scopes.clienttimeoutdescription: Sets the amount of time Lucee will keep the client scope alive.
scopes.domaincookiesdescription: Enable or disable domain cookies. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
scopes.localmodeClassicDesc: the local scope is only invoked when the key already exists in it
scopes.localmodedesc: Defines how the local scope of a function is invoked when a variable with no scope definition is used.
scopes.localmodeModernDesc: the local scope is always invoked
scopes.mergeurlformdescription: This setting defines if the scopes URL and Form will be merged together (CFML Default is false). If a key already exists in Form and URL Scopes, the value from the Form Scope is used.
scopes.server: You can define the scope settings that will be used as default for all web contexts here.
scopes.sessionmanagementdescription: By default session management can be enabled. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
scopes.sessiontimeoutdescription: Sets the amount of time Lucee will keep the session scope alive. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
scopes.sessiontypedescription: JEE Sessions allow to make sessions over a cluster. When you change this setting, you will lose your current session and you must make a new login
scopes.timeoutendvalue: timeout must have an Integer Value
scopes.web: Here you can define the settings for how Lucee handles scopes.

search.description: Here you can manage, create, populate and delete search collections. By default, Lucee uses Apache Lucene as the search engine.
search.directorypathmissing: Please enter a path to be indexed
search.fileextensionsmissing: Please enter the file extensions to be indexed
search.missing_name: Please enter a name for the collection
search.missing_path: Please enter a valid path for the collection
search.name: Name
search.result: Results {startrow} - {endrow} of about {recordcount} searched in {recordssearched} Records

security.accessreaddesc: define the access for reading data
security.accesswritedesc: define the access for writing data
security.cachedescription: The cache settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.cfmlenvironmentdescription: Settings that have an effect on how Lucee code interacts with the host environment
security.cfxdescription: The settings for the cfx tags can be changed. The globally defined CFX tags defined in the "server administrator" can be used as well.
security.cfxtagsdescription: With CFX tags one can load Java classes which might have full access to the local hosts system. This might be a potential security risk to the hosts system
security.customtagdescription: The custom tag settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.datasourcedescription: Defines how many datasources can be added in the "web administrator".
security.debuggingdescription: The debugging settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.desc: Define the access rights for the different web contexts (webapps). Under the "general" tab you can define default rights for all web contexts that do not have a specific definition in the "individual" tab.
security.filecustomdesc: You can define additional directories where file access is allowed
security.filedescription:
Defines how Lucee can interact with the local filesystem in a web context.
- none: allows no access to the filesystem at all
- local: allows only access to the filesystem within the webroot
- all: allows full file access on the hosts filesystem
security.functionsdescription: Tags and Functions that might be a potential risk to the host system
security.gatewaydescription: The gateway settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.generaldesc: Define the General Access for administrator and tag cfadmin
security.javaaccessdescription: Allows access to Java methods and properties from the Lucee code (Example: stringValue.substring(2,5)). Allowing access to Java methods and properties might be a potential security risk
security.maildescription: The mail settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.mappingdescription: Allows adding, removing and updating of mappings in the "web administrator".
security.ormDescription: The ORM settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.remotedescription: It allows the settings in the administrator to be synchronized with other Lucee contexts
security.scheduledtaskdescription: The scheduled task settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.searchdescription: The search settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.settingsdescription: The settings (regional,component and scope) can be changed in the "web administrator"
security.specialdesc: Define the security settings for a specific web context (webapps).
security.speclisttext: Security settings for a specific web context. You can edit or delete these contexts.
security.tagexecutedescription: This tag is used to execute a process on the local hosts system
security.tagimportdescription: This tag can be used to import JSP and Lucee tag libraries
security.tagobjectdescription: With the tag CFObject and the function CreateObject you can load Java objects. If disabled, you only can create objects of type "component"
security.tagregistrydescription: With the tag CFRegistry you have full access to the registry of the local hosts system
security.title: Default access rights
security.titledescription: Here you can define the access rights that will be used as a default for all web contexts. If allowed, you can overwrite some of the settings in the corresponding "web administrator".
security.webadministratordescription: Here you can define the access rights for the settings that can be overridden in the "web administrator".

certificate.desc: List SSL Certificates for a specific Host or install them.
certificate.hostValidation: Missing value for text input field "host"
certificate.noCert: There is no Certificate available from this host.
certificate.subject: Subject

update.alertMessage: Currently no update available for your version
update.chkInternet: Unable to connect to the update server to get the list of Available Extensions. Please check your Internet Connection
update.customDesc: Versions came from custom URL given by the user
update.desc: You can patch Lucee in order to receive the latest bug fixes and improved version.
update.downgradeVersion: To downgrade your version below {minVersion} you need to replace your lucee.jar with an older version one you can download {url}. This is because the lucee.jars always bundles a version itself and it will always use at least that version.
update.downUpDesc: Upgrade or downgrade your current version.
update.exedesc: Apply the latest patch for your version. After the update has been installed Lucee will be restarted, all sessions will be cleared and you have to login again.
update.installExtns: All of the extensions are installed / Unable to connect to the update server to get the list of Available Extensions. Please check your Internet Connection.
update.jira: For details go to our {a}Bug Tracking System{/a}
update.libDesc: Your JAR's are out of date. In order to update your JAR's, please click the button below. This might not work if you do not have a proper internet connection. If the download did not succeed, please download the latest JAR's from our download section and update the JAR's manually. You have to restart your Servlet engine, so that the changes take effect.
update.location_customDesc: Lucee allows you to define your own update provider by simply defining the URL to the rest service providing the necessary data. Please consult the Lucee Documentation on {url} for more details on how to define a custom update provider
update.location_devDesc: This Update Provider (dev.lucee.org) returns ""Bleeding Edge"" versions. Usually only a small amount of testing has been performed on these versions. This source should NOT be used for production environments.
update.location_previewDesc: This Update Provider (preview.lucee.org) returns public preview versions. Versions are tested, but not as deeply as stable releases. This source could be used for production environments. Please use caution.
update.location_releaseDesc: Releases are heavily tested and are recommended for production environments.
update.location_snapshotDesc: Snapshots are generated automatically with every push to the repository, when all bundled test cases pass successfully. Snapshots are NOT recommended for production environments.
update.location_wwwDesc: This Update Provider (release.lucee.org ) returns only stable versions. The versions found here are deeply tested. This source is recommended for production environments.
update.locdesc: Define the URL where Lucee gets its updates. Typically "https://www.lucee.org"
update.noupdate: There is no patch available for version {current}
update.noUpdateDesc: There are currently no {type} available for your version.
update.pre_ReleaseDesc: Pre releases a preview on upcoming releases. This version are in testing to get releases as soon they pass the testing process.
update.releaseDesc: Releases are heavily tested and are recommended for production environments.
update.removedesc: Remove all installed patches or only latest.
update.serverFailed: server {url} failed to return a valid response.
update.setdesc: Define where Lucee gets its patches. Lucee will restart automatically after the update in order for the changes to take effect.
update.snapShotDesc: Snapshots are generated automatically with every push to the repository, when all bundled test cases pass successfully. Snapshots are NOT recommended for production environments.
update.titleDesc: Upgrade or Downgrade the version by selecting from the drop-down box below.
update.loaderMinVersion: You cannot downgrade below {min-version} because your lucee.jar has bundled this version.
update.loaderPath: To downgrade below this version you need to replace your lucee.jar, found at [ {loaderPath} ] with an older version.
update.typedesc: Define how Lucee will be patched. "Automatic" means that Lucee searches automatically for updates once a day. "Manual" means that you can update Lucee only manually here.
update.update: A patch {available} is available for your current version {current}.

setting.allowCompressionDescription: Enable compression (GZip) for the Lucee Response stream for text-based responses when supported by the client (Web Browser)
setting.bufferOutputDescription: If true - the output written to the body of the tag is buffered and is also outputted in case of an exception. Otherwise, the content to body is ignored and not displayed when a failure occurs in the body of the tag.
setting.cachecleardesc: Press the button above to clear the {name} cache.
setting.cachedesc: Different Cache and Performance settings to improve overall performance
setting.cfmlWriterWS: Simple whitespace management - every whitespace character that follows whitespace is removed
setting.cfmlWriterWSPref: Smart whitespace management - every whitespace character that follows a whitespace is removed, but whitespace inside the tags: <code>, <pre> and <textarea> is kept
setting.compiler: Lucee compiler settings affect how the Lucee Compiler parses the source code. Changing these settings flushes all existing class files and triggers a recompilation.
setting.componentcachecleardesc: Press the button above to clear the component path cache.
setting.cpuDesc: Average CPU load of the last 20 seconds on the whole system and this Java Virtual Machine (Lucee Process).
setting.ctcachecleardesc: Press the button above to clear the custom tag path cache.
setting.dotNotationOriginalCaseDesc:
Keep all struct keys defined with "dot notation" in original case (according to the "bracket notation").
Example:
sct.dotNotation --> keyname: "dotNotation"
sct["bracketNotation"] --> keyname: "bracketNotation"
setting.dotNotationUpperCaseDesc:
Convert all struct keys defined with "dot notation" to upper case.
Example:
sct.dotNotation --> keyname: "DOTNOTATION"
sct["bracketNotation"] --> keyname: "bracketNotation"
setting.externalizeStringGTEDesc: Externalize strings from generated class files to separate files. This can drastically reduce the memory footprint for templates but can have a negative impact on execution times. A lower "breakpoint" will cause slower execution than a higher breakpoint.

general.compatibilityDesc: Mit diesem Wert werden alle Settings so gesetzt, dass sie mÃ¶glichst dem CFML2009 Standard entsprechen und mit Implementationen anderer Hersteller kombatibel sind.
general.server: Here you see an overview of all settings that have an influence on the behavior of Lucee, you can adjust them according to predefined criteria
general.speedDesc: Mit diesem Wert werden alle Settings so gesetzt, dass sie eine mÃ¶glichst schnelle AusfÃ¼hrung des Code erlauben.
general.strictDesc: Mit diesem Wert werden alle Settings so gesetzt, dass Lucee so streng wie mÃ¶glich mit der Umsetzung des Code ist.
general.web: Hier sehen Sie eine Ãœbersicht alle Settings welche Einfluss auf das Verhalten von Lucee haben, sie kÃ¶nnen diese nach vordefinierten kriterien anpassen

setting.handleUnquotedAttrValueAsStringDesc:
Handle unquoted tag attribute values as strings.
Example:
<cfmail subject=sub from="#f#" to="#t#"/>
The value from attribute "subject" is not quoted. If enabled, the string "sub" is submitted to the tag. If disabled, Lucee looks for a variable "sub".
setting.inspecttemplatealwaysdesc: Choosing 'Always' ensures all files in the template cache are checked for updates during each request. While it guarantees the use of the latest template versions, it may impact request performance due to increased file system overhead.
setting.inspectTemplateAutoDesc: Lucee in 'Auto' mode optimizes request performance by conducting background checks intermittently to determine if templates have been modified and no check before loading a template. This ensures minimal impact on request processing times while maintaining timely updates through automatic detection of file modifications, like 'fileWrite'.
setting.inspecttemplateneverdesc: Selecting 'Never' results in optimal request performance by avoiding re-inspection of cached files for updates. Ideal for environments where templates are static during the server's runtime.
setting.inspecttemplateoncedesc: The 'Once' option entails inspecting each requested file for updates just once per request. It strikes a balance between minimizing file system overhead and accommodating updates made earlier in the server's uptime.
setting.inspectTemplateIntervalDesc: In 'Auto' mode, Lucee conducts background checks for detecting changes in templates, effectively balancing performance with update responsiveness. The Standard Check Interval, defined in milliseconds, determines the usual frequency of these checks. When a change is detected, Lucee shifts to the Accelerated Check Interval for more frequent monitoring, thus increasing responsiveness to any further changes. Instead of immediately reverting to the standard interval, Lucee gradually transitions from the accelerated pace back to the standard frequency over time, ensuring a smoother adjustment between heightened monitoring and regular operation. Configure these intervals based on the expected frequency of updates to your templates and your specific performance considerations.
setting.inspectTemplateIntervalSlowDesc: Set the frequency, in milliseconds, for regular background checks. This interval is used for routine monitoring of template changes.
setting.inspectTemplateIntervalFastDesc: Accelerated Check Interval (ms): Specify a shorter interval, in milliseconds, for enhanced monitoring. This interval is activated for the next 100 checks following a detected change, ensuring more responsive updates when changes are frequent.
setting.memoryDesc: Memory used by the JVM, heap and non heap.
setting.preciseMathDesc: If enabled, this improves the accuracy of floating point calculations but makes them slightly slower.
setting.queuedDesc: Request in queued waiting to execute.
setting.reqDesc: Web requests running at the moment.
setting.requestDesc: Requests and CF Threads (started by a request) currently running on the system.
setting.scopesDesc: Scopes held in memory. (Session/client scopes stored in external cache or datasource leave memory after 60 seconds of inactivity)
setting.showversiondescription: Return the Lucee version in the response header
setting.suppressContentDescription: Suppress content written to response stream when a Component is invoked remotely. Only works if the content was not flushed before.
setting.suppressWSBeforeArgDesc:
If set, Lucee suppresses whitespace defined between the "cffunction" starting tag  and the last "cfargument" tag.
	This setting is ignored when there is a different output between this tags as white space.
setting.taskDesc: Active and failed tasks in the Task Spooler. This includes tasks to send E-mail messages.
setting.templatecachecleardesc: Press the button above to clear the Page Pool cache. This cache is used to cache the template object classes (loaded source code).
setting.whitespacedescription: Removes all white spaces in the output that follow a white space

settings.appcfcdesc: You can also set this in the Application.cfc as follows
settings.sysopenvvar: You can also set the default behaviour as System Property or Enviroment Variable
settings.appcfcSomedesc: Some of this settings can be done in the Application.cfc as well

cache.defaultDesc: Define the default cache connection for templates (cfcache) and object (cacheGet, cachePut ...), this connection is used when no cache name is explicit defined
cache.defaultDesc2: Define if this connection will be the default cache connection, the default cache connection is used when no cache name is explicit defined
cache.defaulttypeFileDesc: This cache connection is used for caching the results of the tag file
cache.defaulttypeFunctionDesc: This cache connection is used for caching the results of the tag cffunction/function
cache.defaulttypeHTTPDesc: This cache connection is used for caching the results of the tag http
cache.defaulttypeIncludeDesc: This cache connection is used for caching the results of the tag include
cache.defaulttypeObjectDesc: This cache connection is used for all object cache operations (cacheGet,cachePut, cfcache action="get|put" ...)
cache.defaulttypeQueryDesc: This cache connection is used for caching the results of the tag cfquery
cache.defaulttypeResourceDesc: This cache connection is used for the Ram Resource (ram://...)
cache.defaulttypeTemplateDesc: This cache connection is used for template caching (cfcache action="content|cache|serverCache" ...)
cache.defaulttypeWebserviceDesc: This cache connection is used for caching the results of webservice calls (SOAP, REST or HTTP).
cache.descExisting: List of all existing connection for this environment
cache.descReadOnly: Readonly cache connections are generated within the ""server administrator"" for all web instances and can not be modified by the ""web administrator"".
cache.name: Name
cache.nameMissing: Please enter a name for the cache
cache.noAccess: no access to create cache connections
cache.noDriver: There is no Cache Driver Available
cache.storageDesc: Allow to use this cache as client/session storage.
cache.title: Cache

settings.codetip: You can do this in your code yourself as follows
settings.DatasourceExtensionServer: Missing the datasource type you are looking for? Click {link}here{/link} to find an extension for the datasource type you require.
settings.DatasourceExtensionWeb: Missing the datasource type you are looking for? Click {linkServer}here{/link} to search for an extension to install for all web contexts or {link}here{/link} for the current context only.
settings.dbblobdesc: Enable binary large object retrieval (<abbr title="binary large object">BLOB</abbr>)
settings.dbclobdesc: Enable long text retrieval (<abbr title="character large object">CLOB</abbr>)
settings.dbconnlimitdesc: Restricts the maximum number of simultaneous connections at one time
settings.dbconntimeoutdesc: Define a time in minutes for how long a connection is kept alive before it will be closed
settings.dbdatabasedesc: Name of the database to connect
settings.dbhostdesc: Host name where the database server is located
settings.dbidletimeoutdesc: Define how long an idle connection will be kept alive, before being closed
settings.dblivetimeoutdesc: Define how long a connection will be kept alive, before being closed
settings.dbMetaCacheTimeoutDesc: define how long Stored Procedures Meta Data are stored in cache
settings.dbportdesc: The port to connect the database
settings.dbStorageDesc: Allow using this datasource for client/session/log storage.
settings.dbtimezoneDesc:
When you define a date as a string (not with cfqueryparam) inside cfquery, there is normally no timezone information with it and the date string is based on the locale timezone. Therefore the database will interpret this date string based on it's own timezone.
If the timezone of your Lucee instance and your database is different, this can lead to problems. Because of that Lucee now allows you to define a timezone for a specific datasource definition. Be aware that you should only define a specific timezone, if you are 100% sure that this timezone is used on the database server and it is different from the timezone of the Lucee instance. This setting can be overwritten by the cfquery attribute "timezone".
settings.dbValidateDesc: Validate the connection before use (only works with JDBC 4.0 Drivers)
settings.exportAppCFCDesc: Export the settings of this Web Context as Application.cfc Template. Only settings possible in Application.cfc will be exported.

gateway.defaultdesc2: Define if this connection will be the default cache connection, the default cache connection is used when no cache name is explicit defined
gateway.descexisting: List of all existing gateways for this environment
gateway.descreadonly: Readonly event gateways are generated within the ""server administrator"" for all web instances and can not be modified by the ""web administrator"".
gateway.ListenerCfcPathDesc: Path to the Component that is listening to the Gateways action
gateway.noaccess: no access to create gateway instances
gateway.nodriver: There is no Gateway Type Available
gateway.title: Gateway

settings.listdatasourcesdescserver: Datasources created here are available for ALL web contexts to use. The settings for these datasources can only be modified in this Server Administrator area.

logging.desc: List of existing Logs for this environment
logging.detailDesc: Log settings for a specific Log
logging.name: Name
logging.noDriver: There are no Appender/Layout drivers in that system
logging.readOnlyDesc: Readonly Logs are generated within the "server administrator" for all web instances and can not be modified by the "web administrator.
logging.title: Logs
logging.mainDesc: Define a default logger to prevent logging failures when specified loggers are missing. If a logger defined in the application doesn't exist, Lucee redirects the logging to this main logger. Without a main logger, Lucee throws an exception when encountering undefined loggers. This setting is only possible via System Property / Enviroment Variable.

settings.name: Name
settings.namemissing: Please enter a name for the datasource
settings.noDriver: There is no driver available for this type, please install a matching Extension for this type.

orm.autogenmapDesc: Specifies whether Lucee should automatically generate mapping for the persistent CFCs. If disabled, mapping should be provided in the form of .HBMXML files. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.autogenmap=true]
orm.catalogDesc: Specifies the default Catalog that should be used by ORM. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.catalog='db']
orm.cfclocationDesc: Specifies the directory that should be used to search for persistent CFCs to generate the mapping. If cfclocation is set, Lucee looks at only the paths specified in it. If it is not set, Lucee looks at the application directory, its sub-directories, and its mapped directories to search for persistent Components. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.cfclocation='...']
orm.dbcreateDesc: Lucee ORM can automatically create the tables for your application in the database when ORM is initialized for the application. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.dbcreate='none']
orm.dbcreateDropcreate: Setting this value drops the table if it exists and then creates it.
orm.dbcreateNone: Setting this value does not change anything in the database schema.
orm.dbcreateUpdate: Setting this value creates the table if it does not exist or update the table if it exists.
orm.desc: Here you can define the default settings for the ORM Configuration. These settings can be overwritten in the Application.cfc with the struct "ormsettings".
orm.eventHandlingDesc: Specifies whether ORM Event callbacks should be given. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.eventHandling=false]
orm.flushatrequestendDesc: Specifies whether ormflush should be called automatically at request end. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.flushatrequestend=false]
orm.logSQLDesc: Specifies whether the SQL queries that are executed by ORM will be logged. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.logSQL=false]
orm.savemappingDesc: Specifies whether the generated Hibernate mapping file has to be saved to file system. If enabled, the Hibernate mapping XML file is saved with the filename ""CFC name"".hbm.xml in the same directory as the CFC. If any value of savemapping is specified in CFC, it will override the value specified in the ormsetting. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.savemapping=false]
orm.schemaDesc: Specifies the default Schema that should be used by ORM. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.schema='sch']
orm.sqlscriptDesc: Path to the SQL script file that gets executed after ORM is initialized. This applies if dbcreate is set to dropcreate. This must be the absolute file path or the path relative to the application. The SQL script file lets you populate the tables before the application is accessed. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.sqlscript='...']
orm.title: Settings
orm.useDBForMappingDesc: Specifies whether the database has to be inspected to identify the missing information required to generate the Hibernate mapping. The database is inspected to get the column data type, primary key and foreign key information. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.useDBForMapping=true]

settings.preservesinglequotesdescription: Preserve single quotes (") in the SQL defined with the tag cfquery
settings.readonlydatasourcesdescription: These datasources have been created in the Server Administrator and are shared with ALL web contexts. You cannot modify these datasources in the Web Administrator, but you can override them by creating your own datasource with the same name.

server.installed: The necessary video components are already installed on your system.
server.installedbut1: The video components are installed but they can not be executed properly:
server.installednotdesc: For the tag cfvideo/cfvideoplayer OS specific video components are required. They are not bundled with Lucee because the size of the software would increase a lot and because some codecs may not be redistributed, although their use is not prohibited. Therefore you can download these components directly from a provider and upload them with the form below.
server.installednotuploaddesc: The video components (ffmpeg.zip) are uploaded directly over the form and copied into Lucee (no installation). As a source you can use e.g. {provider}
server.installednoturldesc: The video components are downloaded automatically from the remote server and copied into Lucee (no installation).
server.installednoturltitle: Download video components by an URL
server.mandesc: A manual installation can be made like follows: Open the url {provider} and download the corresponding file ffmpeg.zip for your operating system ({OS-Name}). Then copy this file (do not unzip it) into the directory {directory}. If you can not find a file for your operating system, just contact us.

web.installed: The video components are installed on your system.
web.installedbut: The video components are installed but they can not be executed properly. Just switch to the Lucee Server Administrator, in order to repair it:
